trans-unit.target: The URL-shortener for education and research with respect for privacy

What is { app_name }?

With { app_name } you can shorten any long URL. You can create a link starting with { app_urldomain }. Use this short link where long URLs are inconvenient, such as in presentation slides or print and on social media.

The short links have the form { app_urldomain }/code and do not expire.

{ app_name } can be used free of charge by all students, staff, and researchers of institutions affiliated with { app_idp_name }.

{ app_name }: respect for privacy

  • is safer and more privacy-friendly than commercial alternatives. Thanks to { app_idp_name } only members can create links. In this way we prevent abuse.
  • does not store any personal data. Through { app_idp_name }, { app_name } only receives a persistent pseudonym.
  • only keeps track of the total number of clicks and does not track visitors.
  • uses modern web standards.

All details and information about your rights can be found in our privacy statement.

Support and contact

Do you want to know how to create a link or do you have a question? Then take a look at the support page.

Creating and editing links

  • To create a shortened link you need a { app_idp_name } account. Select your setting from the list. If your setting is not there yet, see below under the heading 'Login'.
  • Paste the URL you want to shorten into the text field. You will get your unique { app_urldomain }-URL, which you can use immediately. The code is random, not case sensitive and without potentially confusing characters (such as the number zero and the letter o).
  • When you are logged in, you will see an overview of all the links you have created. For each link you will see the total number of visits since the creation date. You can edit (change the target link) or delete these links.
  • If a short link is removed, it will not be reissued: all links are unique. So another user will never get a shortened link that you have removed.

Anyone can open { app_urldomain } links

Anyone can open a { app_urldomain } link by typing it into a browser or clicking on it. The links are not case sensitive.

Login

Is the institution where you work or study not yet listed when logging in via { app_idp_name }? Then the service is not yet available to you.

Every institution affiliated with { app_idp_name } can link this service free of charge. Is your institution affiliated with { app_idp_name } but you cannot log in yet? Ask your own service desk if they can arrange this for you.
